answers.answer: If it's been going on most of your life then I doubt it's an STD. But, to be on the safe side get tested. Have you ever been tested for diabetes? If not, I think it might be good idea. I would start with those 2 things first. If they come out alright then see a Urologist.
Sugar diabetes does run in my family actually - so I will be sure to check in on that. Thanks for the response!

question: Maybe once every 2-3 weeks I will have a very quick (basically an instant) amount of discomfort while urinating. Generally, this occurs if I "push" while urinating (which I do for no particular reason) and I am usually dehydrated - I urinate frequently when I am hydrated - this has gone on my entire life. Any idea, though, why I experience the slight discomfort occasionally? Could it be std related?
title: Slight pain during urination
